contentrichtext.text: {{Prince Edward Island County |Reference Name = Kings County |Map = Image:Prince Edward Island Kings County.svg |Area = 1,684.35 |Population = 23,108 |Population Density = 11.0 |Average Earnings = $36,407 |Incorporated Towns = [[Georgetown, Prince Edward Island|Georgetown]] (town), [[Montague, Prince Edward Island|Montague]] (town), [[Souris, Prince Edward Island|Souris]] (town) |Parishes = [[St. Patrick's Parish, Prince Edward Island|St. Patrick's Parish]], [[East Parish, Prince Edward Island|East Parish]], [[St. George's Parish, Prince Edward Island|St. George's Parish]], [[St. Andrew's Parish, Prince Edward Island|St. Andrew's Parish]] |Townships = [[Kings Royalty, Prince Edward Island|Kings Royalty]], [[Lot 38, Prince Edward Island|Lot 38]], [[Lot 39, Prince Edward Island|Lot 39]], [[Lot 40, Prince Edward Island|Lot 40]], [[Lot 41, Prince Edward Island|Lot 41]], [[Lot 42, Prince Edward Island|Lot 42]], [[Lot 43, Prince Edward Island|Lot 43]], [[Lot 44, Prince Edward Island|Lot 44]], [[Lot 45, Prince Edward Island|Lot 45]], [[Lot 46, Prince Edward Island|Lot 46]], [[Lot 47, Prince Edward Island|Lot 47]], [[Lot 51, Prince Edward Island|Lot 51]], [[Lot 52, Prince Edward Island|Lot 52]], [[Lot 53, Prince Edward Island|Lot 53]], [[Lot 54, Prince Edward Island|Lot 54]], [[Lot 55, Prince Edward Island|Lot 55]], [[Lot 56, Prince Edward Island|Lot 56]], [[Lot 59, Prince Edward Island|Lot 59]], [[Lot 61, Prince Edward Island|Lot 61]], [[Lot 63, Prince Edward Island|Lot 63]], [[Lot 64, Prince Edward Island|Lot 64]], [[Lot 66, Prince Edward Island|Lot 66]] |Census Year = 2011 |Counties North = none |Counties East = none |Counties West = Queens |Counties South = none }} '''Kings County''' (2011 population 23,108) is located in eastern [[Prince Edward Island]], [[Canada]]. It is the province's smallest, most rural and least-populated county. Kings County is also least dependent upon the agriculture industry compared with the other two counties, while being more heavily dependent on the fishery and forest industry. Comparatively large parts of the county are still forested and it hosts the province's largest sawmill. The only heavy industry, aside from forestry and industrial farming, is a small shipyard, although secondary manufacturing has been established in recent years. The county was named by Capt. [[Samuel Holland]] in 1765 for King [[George III of the United Kingdom|George III]] (1738-1820). As such, Kings County's [[shire town]] is [[Georgetown, Prince Edward Island|Georgetown]]. The largest town is [[Montague, Prince Edward Island|Montague]]. In 2008, Kings County was the region with the second highest self-reported obesity rate in Canada.<ref>http://www.cihi.ca/CIHI-ext-portal/internet/en/document/factors+influencing+health/release_20june11_fig2</ref> ==Communities== *'''Towns''' **[[Georgetown, Prince Edward Island|Georgetown]] **[[Montague, Prince Edward Island|Montague]] **[[Souris, Prince Edward Island|Souris]] *'''Municipalities''' **[[Annandale-Little Pond-Howe Bay, Prince Edward Island|Annandale-Little Pond-Howe Bay]] **[[Brudenell, Prince Edward Island|Brudenell]] **[[Cardigan, Prince Edward Island|Cardigan]] **[[Central Kings, Prince Edward Island|Central Kings]] **[[Eastern Kings, Prince Edward Island|Eastern Kings]] **[[Little Pond, Prince Edward Island|Little Pond]] **[[Lorne Valley, Prince Edward Island|Lorne Valley]] **[[Lower Montague, Prince Edward Island|Lower Montague]] **[[Morell, Prince Edward Island|Morell]] **[[Murray Harbour, Prince Edward Island|Murray Harbour]] **[[Murray River, Prince Edward Island|Murray River]] **[[Souris West, Prince Edward Island|Souris West]] **[[St. Peters Bay, Prince Edward Island|St. Peters Bay]] *'''Unincorporated''' **[[Fortune Bridge, Prince Edward Island|Fortune Bridge]] **[[Valleyfield, Prince Edward Island|Valleyfield]] *'''Indian reserves''' **[[Morell 2, Prince Edward Island|Morell 2]] ==See also== * [[Royal eponyms in Canada]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord|46|15|N|62|30|W|region:CA_type:city|display=title}} ==External links== *[http://www12.statcan.ca/english/census06/data/profiles/community/Details/Page.cfm?Lang=E&Geo1=CD&Code1=1101&Geo2=PR&Code2=11&Data=Count&SearchText=Kings&SearchType=Begins&SearchPR=01&B1=All&GeoLevel=&GeoCode=1101 2006 Community Profile: Kings County, Prince Edward Island; Statistics Canada] {{Subdivisions of Prince Edward Island|counties=yes}} <!--Stubs--> <!--Categories--> [[Category:Kings County, Prince Edward Island| ]] {{PrinceEdwardIsland-geo-stub}}
